name: Juan Rabelo
aboutMe:
Passionate and results-driven developer with expertise in SAPUI5/Fiori, SAP BTP, and SAP Customer Portal, 
as well as strong knowledge in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Node.js, and TypeScript.

I specialize in creating intuitive and high-performance applications, always focusing on providing the best user experience. 
My ability to solve complex problems, combined with a solid technical foundation, allows me to develop innovative solutions aligned with business objectives.

Fluent in English and with a collaborative profile, I work closely with global teams, 
ensuring efficient communication and the successful delivery of projects.

I am always eager to learn and explore new technologies, committed to producing high-quality work, and ready to take on new challenges.

Let's connect and discuss how I can contribute to your next project!

projects.title: Equipment Cockpit - Axians
projects.situation: The company needed a tool for technicians to manage local equipment.
projects.task: Develop a web solution to manage this equipment, including actions such as reversal, validation, and modification of specific fields.
projects.action: I implemented a SAPUI5 freestyle app connected to the company's oData backend, creating a list report model application to manage all equipment.

projects.title: PEC Report Generation - Axians
projects.situation: Employees needed to generate a report with site information, including equipment, locations, anomalies, and contracts.
projects.task: Create a web solution that would generate Word documents on the frontend for five different types of reports.
projects.action: I developed a SAPUI5 freestyle app using the Docx.js library to generate these reports, retrieving information from the oData service. The document included multiple sections such as summaries, headers, footers, tables, charts, and forms.
projects.result: Improved efficiency in generating and organizing site information.

projects.title: Offline Time Tracking - BRFactory
projects.situation: Field management needed a mobile application to register employee attendance in remote areas such as forests.
projects.task: Develop a mobile application that could register time entries (NFC reading) and later synchronize with the SAP system.
projects.action: I built a mobile app using the Cordova framework and SAPUI5 to create all functionalities. Additionally, I developed an oData service to retrieve employee data and synchronize time entries.
projects.result: Employees working in remote areas could register their time using a tablet managed by a supervisor.

projects.title: Venda Mais (Novaforma) - BRFactory
projects.situation: NovaForma's salespeople had a mobile sales app, and the company's managers needed a portal to approve, validate, and manage sales orders that required discounts or special approvals.
projects.task: Develop a web portal to display pending sales approvals.
projects.action: I developed a SAPUI5 application using the Tool Page layout, which included an approval tab. The app connected to the SAP backend and a Node.js API developed by our team, integrated with the client's MongoDB database.
projects.result: Approvers could review and approve sales directly from the Fiori Launchpad, eliminating the need to use SAP GUI, improving usability and user experience.
